definition: lasting for a very short time
example: The beauty of the sunset was ephemeral, disappearing as quickly as it arrived.

definition: open to more than one interpretation
example: The instructions were ambiguous and led to confusion.

definition: seeming reasonable or probable
example: Her explanation seemed plausible given the evidence at hand.

definition: to hinder, restrain, or prevent
example: The new policy will inhibit the company's growth.

definition: not having any serious purpose or value
example: They spent money on frivolous items instead of saving for the future.

definition: truthful and straightforward; frank
example: She gave a candid interview about her experiences.

definition: to make less severe, serious, or painful
example: The measures were taken to mitigate the impact of the economic downturn.

definition: able to recover quickly from difficulties; tough
example: Her resilient attitude helped her bounce back from the setback.

definition: fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing
example: The president gave an eloquent speech that inspired the audience.

definition: to agree or have the same opinion
example: I concur with your assessment of the situation.

definition: dealing with things sensibly and realistically
example: Her pragmatic approach to problem-solving made her an effective leader.

definition: showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
example: His meticulous research ensured that every detail was accurate.

definition: not certain or fixed; provisional
example: They made tentative plans for the weekend but were open to changes.

definition: to place or deal with close together for contrasting effect
example: The artist juxtaposed bright colors with dark backgrounds to create a striking effect.

definition: completely baffled; very puzzled
example: The complex instructions left me feeling perplexed and confused.

definition: famous or well known, typically for some bad quality or deed
example: The criminal was notorious for his elaborate heists.

definition: perceptible by touch; capable of being touched or felt
example: The results of the project were tangible and easily measurable.

definition: having knowledge or being aware of
example: She was cognizant of the risks involved in the investment.

definition: lasting only for a short time; impermanent
example: The transient nature of the job meant that she had to constantly adapt to new environments.

definition: given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior
example: Her capricious nature made it difficult for others to predict her reactions.

definition: a departure from what is normal, usual, or expected, typically one that is unwelcome
example: The sudden drop in temperature was an aberration for this time of year.

definition: attempting to avoid notice or attention, typically because of guilt or a belief that discovery would lead to trouble
example: He cast a furtive glance over his shoulder to make sure no one was watching.

definition: intelligently analytical and clear-thinking
example: Her incisive comments during the meeting helped clarify the complex issues.

definition: tending to keep a firm hold of something; clinging or adhering closely
example: Her tenacious spirit allowed her to overcome numerous obstacles in her career.

definition: experienced in the imagination through the feelings or actions of another person
example: She lived vicariously through her friend's thrilling adventures.

definition: showing or feeling no interest, enthusiasm, or concern
example: His apathetic attitude towards the project was evident in his lack of effort.

definition: hostile and aggressive
example: The belligerent attitude of the opposing team made negotiations difficult.

definition: wary and unwilling to take risks
example: She was circumspect in her investments, carefully weighing all risks.

definition: make (someone) weak and infirm
example: The illness had begun to debilitate him, making daily tasks challenging.

definition: cheerful and full of energy
example: Her ebullient personality made her a favorite at social gatherings.

definition: unfortunate
example: The hapless traveler lost his passport and missed his flight.

definition: feeling or expressing great happiness and triumph
example: The crowd was jubilant after the home team won the championship.

definition: having or showing eagerness or enthusiasm
example: She was keen to start her new job and make a positive impression.

definition: affected by lethargy; sluggish and apathetic
example: He felt lethargic after staying up all night studying for exams.

definition: stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or chosen course of action, despite attempts to persuade one to do so
example: Despite the evidence, he remained obstinate in his belief that he was right.

definition: excessively concerned with minor details or rules; overscrupulous
example: Her pedantic approach to editing made her difficult to work with.

definition: tending to induce drowsiness or sleep
example: The professor's soporific lecture caused many students to fall asleep.

definition: reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little
example: His taciturn nature made it difficult for others to get to know him.

definition: wanting or devouring great quantities of food
example: He had a voracious appetite and could eat an entire pizza by himself.

definition: having or showing a feeling of vague or regretful longing
example: She gave a wistful look at the old photographs from her childhood.

definition: having or showing a dislike of or prejudice against people from other countries
example: His xenophobic comments were met with widespread condemnation.

definition: giving way under pressure; not hard or rigid
example: The clay was yielding to his sculpting tools, allowing for intricate designs.

definition: the time at which something is most powerful or successful
example: The company reached its zenith during the early 2000s, dominating the industry.

definition: to become less intense or widespread
example: The storm finally began to abate after hours of heavy rain.

definition: well-meaning and kindly
example: Her benevolent actions earned her the admiration and gratitude of the community.

definition: having or showing care and conscientiousness in one's work or duties
example: She was a diligent student, always completing her assignments on time.

definition: deriving ideas, style, or taste from a broad and diverse range of sources
example: The restaurant's decor was eclectic, featuring a mix of vintage and modern elements.

definition: having or displaying a passionate intensity
example: Her fervent support for the cause inspired many others to get involved.

definition: relevant to a subject under consideration
example: The lawyer's arguments were germane to the case at hand and were well-received by the judge.

definition: the practice of claiming to have moral standards or beliefs to which one's own behavior does not conform
example: The politician's hypocrisy was exposed when he was found to be living in luxury while preaching austerity.

definition: treating all rivals or disputants equally; fair and just
example: An impartial judge is essential to ensure a fair trial for all parties involved.

definition: expressed clearly; easy to understand
example: The professor's lucid explanation of complex concepts made the material accessible to all students.

definition: lacking interest or excitement; dull
example: He was tired of his mundane job and longed for a more exciting career.

definition: feeling or appearing casually calm and relaxed; not displaying anxiety, interest, or enthusiasm
example: She remained nonchalant despite the chaos around her, maintaining her composure.

definition: a state of perplexity or uncertainty over what to do in a difficult situation
example: He was in a quandary about whether to accept the job offer or stay at his current position.

definition: the occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way
example: Finding the perfect book at a garage sale was a delightful example of serendipity.

definition: regard with great respect; revere
example: The community venerated the local hero for his bravery and selflessness.

definition: feeling or showing caution about possible dangers or problems
example: She was wary of the unfamiliar situation and took precautions before proceeding.

definition: have an intense feeling of longing for something, typically something that one has lost or been separated from
example: She yearned for the days when life was simpler and more carefree.

definition: a gentle, mild breeze
example: The zephyr gently rustled the leaves, bringing a sense of peace to the garden.

definition: sudden and unexpected
example: The car came to an abrupt stop when the driver saw the deer crossing the road.

definition: active, fast, and energetic
example: She took a brisk walk around the park to start her day with energy.

definition: waste time; be slow
example: Stop dawdling and get your homework done before dinner.

definition: an obscuring of the light from one celestial body by the passage of another between it and the observer or between it and its source of illumination
example: The solar eclipse was a breathtaking event that attracted many viewers.

definition: sparing or economical with regard to money or food
example: His frugal nature allowed him to save a significant amount of money over the years.

definition: see or perceive briefly or partially
example: I caught a glimpse of the celebrity as he passed by the window.

definition: create difficulties for (someone or something), resulting in delay or obstruction
example: The construction work will hinder traffic flow on the main road for several months.

definition: clever, original, and inventive
example: The ingenious design of the new gadget won several awards for innovation.

definition: a passionate expression of grief or sorrow
example: The lament for the lost loved one was heard across the entire town.

definition: follow a winding course
example: We decided to meander through the countryside instead of taking the direct route.

definition: quick and light in movement or action; agile
example: The nimble dancer performed intricate steps with grace and speed.

definition: no longer produced or used; out of date
example: With the advent of smartphones, many people consider pagers to be obsolete.

definition: acting with or showing care and thought for the future
example: It is prudent to save a portion of your salary for emergencies.

definition: attractively unusual or old-fashioned
example: They stayed in a quaint bed-and-breakfast that looked like it was from a bygone era.

definition: feel deep respect or admiration for (something)
example: The community revered the local leader for his wisdom and dedication.

definition: enjoy or appreciate (something pleasant) completely, especially by dwelling on it
example: She savored every bite of the delicious meal, taking her time to enjoy it.

definition: free from disturbance; calm
example: The lake was tranquil, with only the sound of birds chirping in the distance.

definition: simultaneous performance of action or utterance of speech
example: The choir sang in unison, creating a powerful and harmonious sound.

definition: producing powerful feelings or strong, clear images in the mind
example: He gave a vivid description of his trip, making everyone feel as though they were there.

definition: have a progressively smaller part of its visible surface illuminated, so that it appears to decrease in size
example: The moon began to wane, gradually shrinking from a full moon to a crescent.

definition: difficult to understand; obscure
example: The professor's lecture was so abstruse that many students struggled to follow along.

definition: a harsh, discordant mixture of sounds
example: The city street was filled with the cacophony of car horns and shouting vendors.

definition: causing harm or damage
example: The use of chemicals in farming can have deleterious effects on the environment.

definition: very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail
example: She was so fastidious about her work that she would often spend hours perfecting every detail.

definition: excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters
example: The garrulous host kept the guests entertained with endless anecdotes and chatter.

definition: just begun and so not fully formed or developed; rudimentary
example: The inchoate project still lacked the structure needed to be considered a viable business plan.

definition: tearful or given to weeping
example: Her lachrymose demeanor at the farewell party showed how much she would miss her friends.

definition: wicked or criminal
example: The detective uncovered the nefarious scheme that had been operating under everyone's nose.

definition: render obscure, unclear, or unintelligible
example: The legal jargon served only to obfuscate the true meaning of the contract.

definition: a person or thing regarded as a perfect example of a particular quality
example: She is a paragon of virtue, always demonstrating kindness and integrity.

definition: exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical
example: His quixotic plans to change the world with just a few thousand dollars were met with skepticism.

definition: having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority or discipline
example: The recalcitrant student refused to follow the school rules and caused numerous disruptions.

definition: having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment; shrewd
example: Her sagacious advice helped the company navigate through its financial troubles.

definition: vigorous or incisive in expression or style
example: The critic's trenchant review left no room for doubt about the film's shortcomings.

definition: present, appearing, or found everywhere
example: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society, seen in almost every hand.

definition: vehement or clamorous
example: The vociferous protests could be heard from miles away as the crowd demanded change.

definition: attractive or appealing in appearance or character
example: Her winsome smile and friendly personality won over everyone she met.

definition: dislike of or prejudice against people from other countries
example: Xenophobia can lead to social divisions and conflict in multicultural societies.

definition: having or showing zeal; fervent
example: His zealous support for the cause was evident in his tireless efforts to promote it.

definition: belonging to a period other than that being portrayed
example: The film's use of modern technology in a historical setting was anachronistic and jarring.

definition: a flattering or pleasing statement or action used to persuade someone gently to do something
example: She was not swayed by the blandishments of the salesperson and made a firm decision.

definition: cease to resist an opponent or an unwelcome demand; surrender
example: The army was forced to capitulate after weeks of relentless siege.

definition: conceal one's true motives, feelings, or beliefs
example: He tried to dissemble his true intentions behind a facade of friendliness.

definition: criticize severely
example: The film critic did not hold back and excoriated the movie for its poor screenplay.

definition: producing or capable of producing an abundance of offspring or new growth; fertile
example: The fecund soil of the valley made it an ideal location for farming.

definition: fond of company; sociable
example: Her gregarious nature made her the life of every party she attended.

definition: a lengthy and aggressive speech
example: The politician's harangue left the audience both excited and exhausted.

definition: a person who attacks cherished beliefs or institutions
example: As an iconoclast, he challenged traditional norms and conventions in his work.

definition: naive, simplistic, and superficial
example: The film's plot was jejune, lacking the depth and complexity expected from a major release.

definition: having complex patterns of colors; multicolored
example: The kaleidoscopic view from the top of the mountain was breathtaking.

definition: displaying or having a disinclination for physical exertion or effort; slow and relaxed
example: After the long run, he felt languid and in need of a rest.

definition: sweet or musical; pleasant to hear
example: The mellifluous tones of the violin captivated the audience.

definition: the lowest point in the fortunes of a person or organization
example: The company's financial troubles reached their nadir before they began to recover.

definition: noisy and difficult to control
example: The obstreperous children made it hard for the teacher to maintain order in the classroom.

definition: translucently clear
example: The pellucid waters of the lake made it easy to see the fish swimming beneath the surface.

definition: representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class
example: The restaurant's dish was the quintessential example of French cuisine.

definition: little known; abstruse
example: The recondite subject of quantum mechanics was beyond the grasp of most students.

definition: a person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage
example: The CEO was surrounded by sycophants who flattered him excessively.

definition: equivalent in seriousness to; virtually the same as
example: His refusal to attend the meeting was tantamount to resigning from his position.

definition: excessively or ingratiatingly flattering; oily
example: The salesman’s unctuous demeanor made him hard to trust.

definition: a change of circumstances or fortune, typically one that is unwelcome or unpleasant
example: The vicissitudes of life have taught her to be resilient and adaptable.

definition: shriveled or wrinkled with age
example: The wizened old man told stories of his youth with a twinkle in his eye.

definition: to join or bring together
example: The two companies decided to yoke their resources to tackle the project more effectively.

definition: the ability to make good judgments and quick decisions, typically in a particular domain
example: Her business acumen helped her to turn the failing company around.

definition: to cause constant or repeated trouble for a person, business, etc.
example: The company was beleaguered by a series of lawsuits that drained its resources.

definition: the use of many words where fewer would do, especially in a deliberate attempt to be vague or evasive
example: His circumlocution in the meeting only served to confuse everyone further.

definition: light, delicate, and translucent (usually used to describe fabric)
example: The diaphanous fabric of the dress flowed elegantly as she walked.

definition: erase or remove completely (something unwanted or unpleasant)
example: The record was expunged after the case was dismissed.

definition: patient self-control; restraint and tolerance
example: His forbearance during the heated argument helped to calm the situation.

definition: pompous or extravagant in language, style, or manner, especially in a way that is intended to impress
example: The grandiloquent speech was full of impressive-sounding but empty phrases.

definition: enabling a person to discover or learn something for themselves
example: The heuristic approach allowed students to learn through exploration and experimentation.

definition: unwilling or refusing to change one's views or to agree about something
example: Her intransigent stance on the issue prevented any form of compromise.

definition: more generous than is usual or necessary
example: The munificent donation greatly aided the charity’s efforts.

definition: in the form of a cloud or haze; hazy
example: The plan was still nebulous and lacked clear details.

definition: carried out with a minimum of effort or reflection
example: His perfunctory response indicated that he was not genuinely interested.

definition: the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class
example: The elegant simplicity of the design was the quintessence of modern minimalism.
